Class AuthenticationSecurity

  • java.lang.Object
    • AuthenticationSecurity

  • public class AuthenticationSecurity
extends java.lang.Object
    The AuthenticationSecurity class is used to hash the password entered by the user and to get and store the hashed password by calling the readUsersFromFile from the ReadAFile class.
    Since:
    2016-10-01
    Version:
    v1.0.0
    Author:
    Stephen McFarlane

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AuthenticationSecurity()
      AuthenticationSecurity default constructor is used to set the following private variables to there default values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getMD5Password(java.lang.String password)
      getMD5Password is the method that takes the password the user entered and hashes it using the MD5 hash that was provided as part of the final assignment.
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      getUsername returns the username entered by the user.
      boolean getValidPassword()
      getValidPassword returns the private boolean that lets the application know if the username and password are valid.
      void setFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
      setFilePath is the setter used to update the private variable filePath
      void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
      setPassword is the setter used to update the private variable password
      void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
      setUsername is the setter used to update the private variable username
      void setValidPassword()
      setValidPassword sets the private boolean variable validPassword to true if the MD5 hash values match for the user.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthenticationSecurity

        public AuthenticationSecurity()
        AuthenticationSecurity default constructor is used to set the following private variables to there default values.
        • username - empty string
        • filePath - empty string
        • password - empty string
        • readFile - initialize new instance of the ReadAFile class
        • validPassword - boolean default value of false

    • Method Detail

      • setUsername

        public void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
        setUsername is the setter used to update the private variable username
        Parameters:
        username - This is the username entered by the user when prompted.

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        getUsername returns the username entered by the user.
        Returns:
        Returns the string username

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        setPassword is the setter used to update the private variable password
        Parameters:
        password - this is the password entered by the user when prompted.

      • setFilePath

        public void setFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
        setFilePath is the setter used to update the private variable filePath
        Parameters:
        filePath - This is the path to the location on disk where the file can be found

      • setValidPassword

        public void setValidPassword()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        setValidPassword sets the private boolean variable validPassword to true if the MD5 hash values match for the user. It leaves the value as false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This is incase the file does not exist.

      • getValidPassword

        public boolean getValidPassword()
        getValidPassword returns the private boolean that lets the application know if the username and password are valid.
        Returns:
        returns true or false based on the login to the application being valid.

      • getMD5Password

        public java.lang.String getMD5Password(java.lang.String password)
        getMD5Password is the method that takes the password the user entered and hashes it using the MD5 hash that was provided as part of the final assignment.
        Parameters:
        password - This is the password the user entered when prompted.
        Returns:
        This returns a MD5 hash of the password provided.
